articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Granada vs Real Madrid in the Spanish La Liga
articles.title: Granada vs Real Madrid: Spanish La Liga - BBC Sport

articles.description: Rory McIlroy cuts Xander Schauffele's lead at the Wells Fargo Championship to one shot with a superb third round in North Carolina.
articles.title: Wells Fargo Championship: Rory McIlroy one shot behind  Xander Schauffele  after third round

articles.description: Burnley are relegated from the Premier League after they cannot secure a win at Tottenham which would keep their hopes alive.
articles.title: Tottenham 2-1 Burnley: Clarets relegated from Premier League after Spurs loss

articles.description: Lauren Price becomes Wales’ first female world champion boxer as she wins via a wide points decision against Jessica McCaskill.
articles.title: Lauren Price vs Jessica McCaskill: Welsh boxer wins world title

articles.description: England overcome an early batting collapse to complete a comfortable 53-run win over Pakistan in the first T20 at Edgbaston.
articles.title: England v Pakistan: Hosts overcome early collapse to win by 53 runs

articles.description: Manchester City put the pressure on Arsenal in the title race by beating Fulham to move two points clear at the top of the Premier League.
articles.title: Fulham 0-4 Manchester City: Josko Gvardiol scores twice to edge Blues closer to title

articles.description: England bowler James Anderson says he is "happy" after announcing he will retire this summer, adding that "it feels like a good time".
articles.title: James Anderson retires: England bowler says it "feels like a good time" to stop

articles.description: Newcastle drop points in their pursuit of European football as Brighton spoil their final home match of the Premier League season by earning a draw at St James’ Park.
articles.title: Newcastle United 1-1 Brighton & Hove Albion: European hopefuls held at St James' Park

articles.description: Nelly Korda's hopes of a record-breaking sixth consecutive LPGA title fade at the Founders Cup.
articles.title: Nelly Korda's hopes of record-breaking sixth straight LPGA title fade away at Founders Cup

articles.description: Hertfordshire 17-year-old Phoebe Gill moves to joint second in this year's women's world 800m rankings by clocking a sensational 1:57.86 in Belfast.
articles.title: Phoebe Gill: English athlete, 17, clocks stunning 1:57.86 800m in Belfast
